aors.model.agtsim
Class AgentMemory

java.lang.Object
  aors.model.agtsim.AgentMemory

public class AgentMemory
extends java.lang.Object

Implementation of an AgentMemory. It is used to save previous actual perception events of an agent. Implementation via a ringbuffer.

Method Detail

existsEventMemory

public boolean existsEventMemory(java.lang.String atStep,
                                 java.lang.String eventType)
This method checks, if there is a perception-event of type eventType in the agent's memory. Store possible result in the lastResults Array. Parameter atStep (first parameter) must have the following format:
[N,M] where N is a positive integer number and M is a positive integer number or * as wildcard.
N - Startindex (1 is smallest index!)
M - Endindex

Parameters:
atStep - Start- and Endindex to look for perception-event in memory.
eventType - Type of perception-event to look for.
Returns:
true, if perception-event if in memory, false otherwise.

getFirstIndexWith

public int getFirstIndexWith(java.lang.String pattern,
                             java.lang.Object... values)
Get the first index in search-results that matches the given condition in the string pattern. The string must have the following format: " <NameOfAttribute> <operator> <placeholder> [<logic>]... "
  • <NameOfAttribute> is the name of an attribute of the perception event.
  • <operator> can be <, > or == <placeholder> can be %d (for double) or %l (for long). This depends on the type of <NameOfAttribute> and type of value in values.
  • <logic> can be && or || and it is optional. It allows you to connect different conditions.
The following arguments are the values for this check.
Examples: 
 getFirstIndexWith("distance > %d && physicalObject == %l", 7.5,23) 
 getFirstIndexWith("velocity < %d", 23.3)

Parameters:
pattern - Conditions
values - Values
Returns:
The first index in lastResults, that matches the given conditions. -1 if there was an error or no match.

lastSearchResults

public java.lang.Object[] lastSearchResults()
Returns the values of the last search result.

Returns:
an Object-Array of events with the last results.
See Also:
getFirstIndexWith(String, Object...)

storeMemories

public void storeMemories(java.util.List<AtomicEvent> events,
                          long currentStep)
Store a list of Events into the AgentMemory.

New events (of the current Simulationstep) will wait on an gate for access. Events of the previous Simulationstep will copy into the memory.

Parameters:
events - the events of the current Simulationstep
currentStep - the current Simulationstep
